comments:
This has been around since M1, but I couldn't find a bug for it.  

1 - create a new profile
2 - install the SDK
3 - uninstall the SDK

You get this exception pretty quickly.  At one time I think Dave was investigating....

Susan, I just tried that on my machine and can't get this. Is this error consistently happening for you? Do stop and restart the agent between install and uninstall?
What is weird here, is that the error you see should only happen when the operation does not contain any operand, which is something that I don't see how we can get.

This was consistently happening yesterday.  The scenario is:

1.  Create a profile "Foo" (accept the defaults in the dialog).
2.  Drag the "SDK" IU from the generated metadata repository into the profile Foo.
3.  The install completes successfully.
4.  Try to uninstall (selecting the SDK IU and choosing uninstall from the menu) and you get the exception.

I do not start and stop the agent, I am just calling the director API for install and uninstall.  

Today, to be sure that it's not a relic of a past problem, I cleaned out my agent data, regenerated metadata, etc. etc. just to be certain.

But today, alas, I can't get the install to complete successfully.  Does this NPE look familiar to anyone?  I've probably seen it before but at this point all the random NPE's that signify something wrong with my environment are starting to blur....  ;-(


!ENTRY org.eclipse.equinox.prov.ui 4 0 2007-09-06 09:32:15.709
!MESSAGE 
!STACK 0

Uninstall is working fine for me now.

I had to throw away all of my workspaces, stop self hosting, and start from scratch.  I'm sure there was a less drastic way to clean up my environment but I couldn't figure it out.  I think I had some stale configuration info somewhere but had trouble finding it.

At any rate, once I started from scratch, I was able to successfully install and uninstall the SDK.
I'm reopening because I have seen this problem in other scenarios and I have a fix pending.
